title: [Self-Directed] Exploring Incidental Application of Universal Design for Learning (UDL) in Higher Education Online Course Design

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in basic online course management and foundational understanding of social themes
context.additional_context: A process exploring how learners composed of current practitioners naturally integrate UDL elements while designing online lectures on social topics

learning_goals: Learners can identify ≥5 cases where UDL’s three principles (engagement, representation, action & expression) were unconsciously applied in online course design
Learners can write self-reflection reports utilizing the sensemaking stages of "cognition-observation-interpretation-action" during course design
Learners can develop ≥3 instructional strategies considering learner diversity when designing online courses on social themes

resources: UDL (Universal Design for Learning) Guidelines Document

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
